sub_title: Software Engineer @ Flexport (Kotlin, Spring Boot, MongoDB, AWS) | Machine Learning Enthusiast
summary:
Hey, nice to meet you!

🙋‍♂️ 𝗪𝗛𝗢 𝗔𝗠 𝗜 

My name is Larsen and I see myself as a driven Software Engineer, Machine Learning Enthusiast and Entrepreneur who is adaptable and thrives in high-pressure and ambiguous environments. I'm very passionate about leadership, teaching, public speaking and motivating people.

💻 𝗪𝗛𝗔𝗧 𝗜 𝗗𝗢 𝗔𝗡𝗗 𝗟𝗢𝗩𝗘

I have been studying software engineering and machine learning for the past few years and I have some experience in optimisation algorithms. I am also very excited about building robust micro-services using different tech stacks. I am currently working at Flexport and helping them build an internal near-real-time Accounting software for P&L visibility of freight shipments using Kotlin, Spring Boot and MongoDB.

Not to forget, due to my passion for knowledge sharing and teaching, I also have 7 years of experience in mentoring FIRST Lego League teams and teaching children about algorithmic thinking using different tools such as EV3 Mindstorm and MIT App Inventor and Python.

💡 𝗪𝗛𝗔𝗧 𝗜 𝗪𝗔𝗡𝗧 𝗧𝗢 𝗟𝗘𝗔𝗥𝗡 𝗔𝗡𝗗 𝗦𝗨𝗣𝗣𝗢𝗥𝗧

I absolutely believe in life-long learning. I am eager to learn as much as possible about leadership, entrepreneurship, software, machine learning and new ways of teaching. I truly believe we can make a better education system using these skills... 

I always like to push myself out of my comfort zone and above all, I value teamwork.

If you have any questions or suggestions regarding Software, Leadership or Education, don't hesitate to connect with me and message me! 

I can't wait to hear your ideas. 😁

awards.title: Best Prediction Hack (Be-terna challenge)
awards.description:
On-boarding new members is painful, especially if they are remote. And right now a lot of companies are battling with employing and on-boarding new young individuals. We tried to tackle this problem and make it easier.

Swirly is an NLP based self-learning algorithm for answering all your new employee's questions. It answers best to its ability and if it doesn't recognize the question, it forwards it to the company's forum. It gets back to you when the question has been answered. The answer is also fed to the algorithm for further learning.

Read more: 
https://devpost.com/software/swirly

projects.title: Chain Reaction at Novo mesto Grammar School
projects.description:
Novo mesto Grammar School has a rich tradition of a variety of extracurricular activities and exciting projects in which students love to participate in. This year we decided to offer them something a little different and even more exciting as we are built a chain reaction experiment that took place through the whole school building.

The project was quite ambitious: a large group of students set up a chain experiment under the mentorship of professors and former students: a series of links that work on physical and chemical principles, with the previous link launching the next one in the chain. The chain experiment was conducted over all 4 floors and through several classrooms and other rooms of the school.

We firmly believe that through such work, we allow students to grow personally, to develop their self-initiative, and to have an excellent working environment in which they enhance creativity, teamwork, critical thinking and put their knowledge into practice.

profile_positions.description:
As part of the Operational Finance team I help build a near-real-time internal accounting software for P&L visibility for freight shipments.

Using Kotlin, Spring Boot and MongoDB to: 

➡️ Import, transform and store data tied to shipments
➡️ Build new features on top of existing micro-services (e.g. integrating Apache Kafka)
➡️ Optimise data processing and transformation logic (e.g. getting rid of excess API calls and data fields)

I also investigate why data is incomplete or incorrect and manage cross-team collaborations since we listen to data streams from a lot of different teams in the United States.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer I

profile_positions.description:
ASEF Junior Fellowship is a 3-year program, which consists of a 10-week research visit to a foreign university under the mentorship of a Slovenian professor who works there. Moreover, you can participate in ASEF's activities in Slovenia and interact with the Slovenian community abroad.

As part of the program:

➡️ I helped with the execution of the virtual ASEF Gala 2021
➡️ Coordinated a workshop ("how to apply") for students who wanted to join the ASEF program
➡️ Helped with the AJF selection process: conducted interviews with students
➡️ Automated and optimized a large part of the AJF application and selection processes withGoogle services (something that took a week is now done in a matter of seconds)
profile_positions.title: Junior Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Used JavaScript, Node.js and MongoDB to: 

➡️ Build new microservices and integrate 3rd party software via webhooks,
➡️ Create serverless components and core functionalities supporting the event driven architecture using AWS SSM, SNS, SQS, Lambda, S3 and DynamoDB,
➡️ Monitor, fix and upgrade microservices in production,
➡️ Write unit tests using Jest.

While building and monitoring production software I also interacted with AWS IAM, CloudWatch, CodePipeline, X-Ray and CodeArtifact.

Last 6 months I also did a lot of PR reviews and mentoring of junior engineers, helping them understand the backend and build quality features.

*My first challenge at NU was to use ReactJS and MaterialUI and build our first PoC dashboard for user data presentation.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Used Python and AWS SageMaker to:

➡️ Build various pre-processing scripts (local data pipelines) for raw user data and preparing it for our machine learning models, visualisations and user dashboard.
➡️ Build multiple machine learning models (age clocks) from carefully selected biomarkers to present biological age of our users based on their unique biology.
➡️ Retrieve and clean, discover and visualise biological data from external databases to help understand and build longevity scores.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Taught the Informatics subject in 2 first-year classes with goals to:

➡️ Teach the students how to use the most popular MS tools (1st semester)
➡️ Show them how our computers are built and how they work (1st semester)
➡️ Teach them basic programming in Python (2nd semester)
➡️ Inspire them to use the internet for learning purposes and gathering relevant information
profile_positions.title: Teacher of Informatics

profile_positions.description:
Worked on a project with Zemanta and their Data Science team as a part of the 𝗗𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗦𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲@𝗨𝗟-𝗙𝗥𝗜 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝘁𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻. This is an annual competition whose main goal is to connect students, academics, and industry. 

Our teams topic was 𝗖𝗹𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗲𝗯 𝘂𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲𝗱 𝗼𝗻 𝗺𝗼𝘂𝘀𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀.

When we navigate the web there are a lot of patterns - how fast are we moving the mouse, where do we pause to read, do we follow the text with the cursor as we read, do we rage-click, etc. 

We were given anonymized sessions with a time-series dataset of mouse movements and some supporting information. The goal of this research project was to see 𝙬𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙘𝙖𝙣 𝙗𝙚 𝙙𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙫𝙚𝙙 𝙛𝙧𝙤𝙢 𝙢𝙤𝙪𝙨𝙚 𝙢𝙤𝙫𝙚𝙢𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨.

The projects work mainly consisted of:

➡️ Data mining and preprocessing (dealing with timestamp data and events), 

➡️ Constructing interesting features and then using them to do clustering (58 different handcrafted features extracted from mouse movements, clicks, scrolls and keyboard presses), 

➡️ Applying other (un)supervised learning methods (k-means, hierarchical clustering, logistic regression, support vector machines, neural networks etc.),

➡️ Creating useful visualizations (using matplotlib, seaborn and other libraries).
profile_positions.title: Junior Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Worked with Additherm Group to 𝗼𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗶𝗿 𝗽𝗿𝗲𝘃𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗿𝗲𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 that involved sending weekly and monthly emails with differently templated excel files.

Since this was highly inefficient we used simple tools and created a new 𝗰𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘇𝗲𝗱 𝘂𝗻𝗶𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺 𝗮𝘂𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗿𝗲𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺. Utilizing Google Forms and Google Scripts we created:

➡️ Standardized forms (questionnaires) for collecting data from all companies
➡️ a Script to process and save data from the forms
➡️ Google Sheets that automatically update and can be used for further data analysis
➡️ a Script for automatic email sending to notifying managers to report their KPIs
profile_positions.title: Junior Software Engineer

company.name: University of Ljubljana, Faculty of Computer and Information Science

profile_positions.company: University of Ljubljana, Faculty of Computer and Information Science
profile_positions.description:
Worked in the Laboratory for Algorithms and Data Structures at the University of Ljubljana, Faculty of Computer and Information Science, to build an algorithm and user interface, in collaboration with my student colleague, that optimizes and automizes the process of fitting different sets of screws in batches. (solving an optimization problem).

➡️ Created an algorithm that sped up the company's process and 𝘀𝗮𝘃𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝘁 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝘀𝘁 𝟭𝟱𝗺𝗶𝗻 𝗽𝗲𝗿 𝗱𝗮𝘆 and got an estimated 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝟭𝟬% 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗶𝗿 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻. It is written in Java using Maven and Excel documents as input and output files.

➡️ Created a prototype model that predicts the number of trays an order of screws will fill. Used python and the libraries: Pandas, Numpy, Seaborn, Sklearn to create a Neural Network and Linear Regression model.

➡️ Created an algorithm that plans which orders need to be filled in trays first in order to get the best possible outcome of fitting them into batches later.
profile_positions.title: Junior Software Engineer

➡️ Taught 5th-grade pupils how to code using EV3 software
profile_positions.title: FIRST Lego League Mentor

profile_positions.description:
What do we do:
✅ We make quality honey cosmetics products from honey and beeswax from local beehives
✅ We support local beekeepers by using their bee products in our cosmetics

What we achieved:
➡️ Launched a natural cosmetics line
➡️ Set up a lab and developed 5 natural honey cosmetics products from scratch
➡️ Researched, opened and registered an independent company as students
➡️ Made our products available in 2 online stores and 2 boutique stores
➡️ Sold over 5000 natural cosmetic products
➡️ Won 2nd place at Genius Olympiad in the category Business in New York, USA (2017)
➡️ 2019 Entrepreneurial Talents at MOS Celjski Sejem, biggest business and fair event in Slovenia

Participations:
💡 Incubees at Ljubljana University Incubator (LUI)
💡 Mentees at Ustvarjalink
profile_positions.title: Co-founder

profile_positions.description:
As a student worked with Linux Ubuntu, Docker and Bitbucket Pipelines to containerize ROS nodes.

➡️ Established a test environment to launch ROS nodes via Bitbucket in Ubuntu, Docker and Bitbucket Pipelines.

➡️ Automized and sped up the process of launching and testing nodes by centralizing the environment so that it works fast on every operating system
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: Attended a 1-month volunteering programme where I helped organize summer camp workshops for kids. I taught 100+ children Math and English through different games and exercises.

FIRST® LEGO® League is a powerful programme for kids (6 - 16 years old), which is designed to get them excited about science and technology while teaching them valuable employment and life skills.

Since 2015, I actively supported the FIRST Lego League in Slovenia. I have been a referee at the Robot Game and a Judge of the Technical Interview.

Seasons I participated in: Trash Trek, Animal Allies, Hydrodynamics, Into Orbit, City Builder, RePLAY
Voluntarily mentored and co-mentored 5 teams, one of which won 3rd place in Programming at International Championship Razorback in Arkansas
